newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares bound higher, outlook promising.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares bound higher, outlook promising.

text.p: Slovenia's blue-chip SBI index closed higher on Thursday, extending its winning streak into the fifth day and brokers are optimistic more gains still lie ahead.

"All blue-chip shares rose today and there is optimism in the air so more gains can be expected over the summer. The new all-time high will most probably be reached if gains continue at the current pace," said one broker.
The SBI index rose 32.82 points or 2.15 percent to 1,557.27. This week alone the index has jumped 5.35 percent.
Overall 17 shares rose and three fell while one was flat and seven untraded. Turnover fell to 333 million tolars from 529.2 million.
"Turnover was down mostly due to lower volume on Lek as it seems like foreigners pulled out for some time and now speculators are in," a broker said.
Mineral water producer and health resort operator Radenska was the most active, easing 0.21 percent to 1,890 tolars on volume of 9,115 shares.
Port operator Luka Koper was the top gainer, jumping 9.20 percent to 2,100 tolars on volume of 3,432 shares.
"Luka is one of the shares that did not rise much recently and brokers see it as an alternative investment," one trader said.
Brokerage Nika led decliners, falling 2.68 percent to 3,600 tolars on volume of 300 shares.
Drug maker Lek firmed 0.28 percent to 35,600 tolars on volume of 1,695 shares. Most traders see Lek rising over 40,000 tolars soon. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
